data.text: Any of various marsupials of the family Macropodidae of Australia and adjacent islands, resembling kangaroos but generally smaller.
data.attributionText: from The American HeritageÂ® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A general native name of the smaller kangaroos of Australia, especially those of the genera Halmaturus and Petrogale; a rock-kangaroo.

Any one of numerous species of kangaroos belonging to the genus Halmaturus, native of Australia and Tasmania, especially the smaller species, as the brush kangaroo (<spn>Halmaturus Bennettii</spn>) and the pademelon (<spn>Halmaturus thetidis</spn>). The wallabies chiefly inhabit the wooded district and bushy plains.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: Any of several species of <xref>marsupial</xref>; usually smaller and stockier than <xref>kangaroos</xref>
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: any of various small or medium-sized kangaroos; often brightly colored
